results.title: Their health is our wealth
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The film shows the various stages of training for degrees in Veterinary Science at the University of Sydney and the University of Brisbane, including academic training and practical training at the University farm. The film also shows aspects of the various fields of work open to graduates (for example private practice with farm animals or pets, research work for government agencies or commercial firms).

results.title: Their campus the sea
results.brief_description: At Jervis Bay Royal Australian Navy College young men are trained for a life at sea to defend Australian shores. Aimed at a complete education the course includes science, engineering, mechanics, some humanities, physical education and sport. The trainees are encouraged to participate in extra activities such as debating and drama. After a year at sea they return to specialise in a particular field.

results.title: Their bridge again: restoration of the Tasman Bridge
results.brief_description: On January 5th, 1975, the Tasman Bridge in Hobart, tragically collapsed, sinking a ship and her cargo and dismembering sections of the bridge in seconds. For 2 1/2 years Hobart was without a central road link across the river, whilst reconstruction work was underway. This was a test of skill of the engineers, and the restoration was a great challenge to all concerned. Work on the project is shown through the various stages until final completion.

results.title: The Zoo
results.brief_description: A visit to one of the world’s largest and most modern zoos, the Chicago Zoological Park. Animals are observed in areas simulating their natural habitat. Features polar and kodiak bears, lions, tigers, kanagaroos, baboons and a variety of familiar and not so familiar animals.

results.brief_description: Describes the zinc die casting industry of Australia, covering mining and refining and manufacture of a wide range of products.

results.title: The Young traveller in London
results.creator_credit: Egon Larsen, H Caspirius, INCA and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A young girl from the Scottish Highlands visits London for the first time, invited by her relatives. She expects to be shown round by them but discovers that they cannot agree on what to show her - for London means something different to them all; finally, as the film shows, she is taken on three separate trips.

results.title: The Young swimmer: the crawl stroke
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the fundamental principles pf the crawl stroke. A troop of championships swimmers demonstrates in turn the various aspects of the stroke - the attainment of balance by combined leg and arm movement; the correct leg action, observed from above, and below the water surface; breathing; arm action, the thumb entering the water first; co-ordinations of all movement; and the turn.

results.title: The Young person's guide to the orchestra
results.brief_description: This video focuses on the unique qualities of each instrument from it’s creation by the manufacturer to the musician who skilfully channels its sound. Narration by conductor Andrew Davis and interviews with world-acclaimed musicians, such as Yo-Yo Ma, provide insight and flavour to describe the instruments and their role in the sound of the orchestra. Suitable for Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: The Young directors
results.creator_credit: Peter Drummond and Beaumaris Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film looks at the way various young film makers in Australia are adapting film to communicate their ideas. A film about films, it mirrors the distinctive style of student films, cutting quickly, moving rapidly over a wide range of activities and places, contrasting different approaches to film study. Thirteen schools from five States were selected as being representative of filmmaking in Australian schools.
